author: Caryn James
title: A New Beginning for ‘Howards End’
text:
“One sound man of business does more good for the world than a dozen of your social reformers,” Henry Wilcox says in the television adaptation of “Howards End,” set to begin airing April 8 on Starz.
The line is lifted almost exactly from E.M. Forster’s 1910 novel about three families in turn-of-the-century England, in which characters grapple with such 21st-century issues as the ethics of getting and giving money, the disparities of class and women’s rights.
...
